Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw different types of land habitats, such as a playground, garden, forest, or parking lot.
The student can identify and draw different types of water habitats, such as a pond, stream, or lake.
The student can include and accurately draw various living things found in each habitat, like trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants, lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams.
The student can draw and label different plants and animals in each habitat, showing the diversity of life.
The student can create comparisons in the drawing to show the different types of living things across various habitats.
The student can depict patterns in their drawing that represent plant and animal diversity in different habitats.
